alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Florence, southwestern Dillon, east central Darlington and south central Marlboro Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Quinby, or 8 miles northeast of Florence. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Quinby, Mechanicsville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus and Oak Grove. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 164 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
